TITLE GOES HERE: A company uses a machine-learning algorithm to determine which job advertisement to display for users searching for technology jobs.  Based on past results, the algorithm tends to display lower-paying jobs for women than for men (after controlling for other characteristics than gender).  What ethical considerations might be considered when reviewing this algorithm?

  <!--begin-answer-->
While answers may vary, some discussion of algorithmic bias would be warranted in terms of the review of this algorithm.
  <!--end-answer-->
